ocr_text: OFFICE OF THE REGISTRAR POLICY NO 1 Policy No. LS 2021 257 LIBRARY USE AND NO OF PAGES: Page tots CONDUCT POLICY EFFECTIVE DATE Effective Date: June 15, 2024 STATEMENT OF PHILOSOPHY The university library serves as the intellectual heart of the academic community, providing resources and space conducive to leaming, research, and scholarly collaboration. This policy ensures equitable access while maintaining an environment suitable for serious study and academic inquiry Respect for shared resources and consideration for others are essential library values. The policy balances individual freedom with collective needs, promoting responsible use of library facilities and materials while fostering an atmosphere of mutual respect. The library supports academic success through accessible collections, professional services, and appropriate study environments. This policy protects these resources for current and future generations of scholars, ensuring sustainability and continued excellence. AAs information literacy becomes increasingly critical in the digital age, the library serves as both repository and learning laboratory. This policy framework supports diverse leaming styles and research methodologies while maintaining standards of academic integrity and intellectual property protection POLICY All students, faculty, and staff have library access during posted hours. Vaid university ID is required for entry and borrowing privieges. Community members may access library resources through guest registration. Borrowing mits: Students may borrow 5 books for two weeks; faculy may borrow 1 books for one semester. Reserve materials circulate for 2 hour or overnight periods. Renewals are permitted f no holds exist. Overdue fines are 10 pesos per day per tem. Slice is required in designated quiet study areas. Group discussion is permitted only in designated colaboration spaces, Food and beverages are prohibited except in designated areas. Mobile phones must be silenced. Laptop use is permitted with headphones, Disruptive behavior including loud conversations, inappropriate use of computers, or harassment of others, will result in immediate removal, Repeated violations may lead to suspension of ibrary privileges. Allibrary materials are university property. Theft, mutiation, or unauthorized removal of materials is subject to disciplinary action and replacement fees. Security checks at exits are mandatory,

This policy provides a structured process for students to take leave while ‘maintaining their academic standing and facilitating their eventual retum to complete their studies. Academic c and student welfare are fundamental to the institution s mission. This policy balances institutional requirements with individual student needs, ensuring fair treatment and clear procedures for all stakeholders. ‘The university is committed to supporting students during challenging times while maintaining academic integrity and program quality. This policy reflects our dedication to student success and institutional excellence in providing flexible yet structured pathways By establishing clear guidelines for leave of absence, the institution aims to reduce uncertainty and provide transparency in administrative processes. Students facing temporary challenges can access this support mechanism while preserving their connection to the academic community POLICY ‘Students may request academic leave for medical, personal, or financial reasons for a maximum of two consecutive ‘semesters. Leave requests must be submitted at least two weeks before the start of the semester or within one week of an ‘emergency. Students on approved leave maintain their enrolment status without academic penalty ‘To request leave, students must submit a formal application through the Office of the Registrar, including supporting documentation. Medical leaves require physician certification. Personal eaves require writen justfication Financial hardship leaves require supporting financial documentation, ‘Students on leave are not required to pay tution but must pay a minimal maintenance fee. Upon retur, students must reapply for admission atleast one month before the intended semester. Priory registration is granted to returning students Leave periods do not count toward maximum residency requirements, Faure to retum after approved leave or to request extension results in automatic withdrawal. Students must maintain good ‘academic standing to be elgible for leave. Those under discipinary probation are not ebgble unless extenuating circumstances are demonstrated.
